sense.name: a border region, line of demarcation
sense.commentary: BOUND[+location][+region][+border] Note: usually occurs in the plural
sense.examples: The ball landed in bounds. That tribe considers the bounds of the ancient forest to be the border of their land. No trash may dumped at sea within the thirty-mile bound of shore. The referee said the player caught the ball out of bounds.

sense.name: a limit, a constraint
sense.examples: Their joy knew no bounds. Traveling back in time may be beyond the bounds of possibility. If for every x in set S, x is less than or equal to a, then a is an upper bound of S. (no element in S exceeds a) Sally's kitchen was out of bounds to us on Thanksgiving. (idiomatic extension)

sense.name: a leap or jump
sense.examples: John ran up the steps in two effortless bounds. The rabbit took a bound to the left and jumped into a hole.
